campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Your army can lay an ambush here.
Your army can lay an ambush here.
The size of this army is displayed as pips on the side of their national flag.
Forts allow armies to remain protected while outside of their cities. If the fort is already occupied you will be in for a battle.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to raid trade route
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Raiding trade routes to steal money from other nations. Your army must stay on the trade route for one turn to carry out the raid.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Your army cannot attack a navy

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your army into this port to deprive the owning nation of its use and leave it in a mess when you leave, forcing them to spend time and money repairing it.
Move your army into this port to deprive the owning nation of its use and leave it in a mess when you leave, forcing them to spend time and money repairing it.
Move your army into this port to deprive the owning nation of its use and leave it in a mess when you leave, forcing them to spend time and money repairing it.
Besiege a city to claim it as your own. Then either develop it as part of your empire, or destroy its buildings, leaving it useless to any other nation.
Attacking this resource will prevent the owning nation from being able to use it.
Attacking this town will prevent the owning nation from being able to use it.
Attack this university to stop any technology research being carried out inside it.
Merge armies to create a larger army or add experienced troops to an army otherwise wet behind the ears.
Merge armies to create a larger army or add experienced troops to an army otherwise wet behind the ears.
Forts allow armies to remain protected while outside of their cities and can be placed strategically to provide defence for your regions.
Not only can ships carry your armies across the sea, but they are also quicker than walking. Send them across the coast close to your destination for a short cut.
Not only can ships carry your armies across the sea, but they are also quicker than walking. Send them across the coast close to your destination for a short cut.
Move your army here if it looks vulnerable to attack, or public order is becoming unstable.

Not only can ships carry your armies across the sea, but they are also quicker than walking. Send them across the coast close to your destination for a short cut.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to challenge the general to a duel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Killing a man in a duel is mostly about personal honour. Sometimes though, its about ridding yourself of a potential threat without sparking war and getting in a sticky political situation.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to challenge target to a duel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: If you win the duel you may rid yourself of competition and prevent this gentleman from killing any of your agents.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: This agent cannot raid trade routes
This agent cannot act against fleets
This agent cannot act against fleets
Right click to challenge target to a duel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: This man is no gentleman, and rumoured to be involved in sabotage, stealing and assassination. Killing him will protect your nation from any trouble he may cause.
Move your gentleman here to decrease the happiness of this city's population.
Move your gentleman here to decrease the happiness of this town's population.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to move gentleman into this army
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: When travelling with an army, a gentleman will be protected from assassination.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to move gentleman into this army
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: When travelling with an army, a gentleman will be protected from assassination.
Move your gentleman here to increase the happiness of this city's population.
Move your gentleman here to increase the happiness of this town's population.
Gentlemen are learned men and moving them into a university will speed up any research occurring there.

Move your agent here to start converting the population to your political alignment.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Your navy cannot attack an army

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Before attacking a navy you can view the size of their fleet by looking at the number of pips by the side of their national flag.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to blockade in port
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Blockading this port is an act of war and will prevent the owning nation from using it for any existing trade routes.
Blockading this port is an act of war and will prevent the owning nation from using it for any existing trade routes.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to raid trade route
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Raiding trade routes will supply your nation with someone elses hard earned money. Your navy must stay on the trade route for one turn to carry out the raid.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Select and move army to embark
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Not only can Ships carry your armies across the sea, but they are also much faster than marching. Send them across the coast close to your destination for a short cut.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Select and move army to embark
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Not only can Ships carry your armies across the sea, but they are also much faster than marching. Send them across the coast close to your destination for a short cut.
Merge fleets to create a larger navy, or to replenish a navy with more experienced ships.
Dock here to replenish your navy or carry out repairs.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Dock your navy in a port
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Dock your navy in a port to replenish you fleet and carry out repairs

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Dock your navy in a port
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Dock your navy in a port to replenish you fleet and carry out repairs

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Dock your navy in a port

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Dock your navy in a port
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Dock your navy in a port to replenish you fleet and carry out repairs

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: This navy cannot create trade routes
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: This navy contains no trade ships. To create a trade route move one of your trade ships into this trade port. However, you can use this navy to defend the post.
A successful attack will allow you to occupy this trade post with trade ships

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to sail to a different theatre
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: There are three different theatres: Europe, America and India. There are also trade theatres where you will find trade posts. Entering a transition zone will bring up the Travel Destinations panel which will help you move between them.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to enter trade post
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Occupying a trading post with a trade ship will generate a new trade route. You may want to defend your trade posts with armed ships as they are valuable and can come under attack.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to attack navy in trade post
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: A successful attack will allow you to occupy this trade post with trade ships

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Disembark by clicking on a port or the coast
Disembark by clicking on a port or the coast
Your navy cannot attack an army
Disembark by clicking on a port or the coast

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Be careful not to lose any ships carrying passengers in battle. If the ship sinks, so will the passengers, and you could lose an entire army!

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to blockade in port
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Blockading this port is an act of war and will prevent the owning faction from using it for any existing trade routes.
Blockading this port is an act of war and will prevent the owning faction from using it for any existing trade routes.

This navy cannot create trade routes
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: This navy contains no trade ships. To create a trade route move one of your trade ships into this trade port. However, you can use this navy to defend the post.
A successful attack will allow you to occupy this trade post with trade ships

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to sail to a different theatre
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: There are three different theatres: Europe, America and India. There are also trade theatres where you will find trade posts. Entering a transition zone will bring up the Travel Destinations panel which will help you move between them.
Trade ships are used to create trade by occupying trade posts. Use your radar to find the trade theatres that contain these posts.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to view their details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: An agent of another nation.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to view the general's detail panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: An army from another nation. They can attack your armies, besiege your cities and blockade your ports.
A fort belonging to another nation. This offers some temporary protection to armies when they are too far from one of their cities.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to view his details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: He is used to help research technologies for his nation and can also challenge other characters to duels.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: This is a trade route. These are used for the import and export of trade
Left click to select, double left click to view the admiral's details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: A navy from another nation. They can be used for sea battles, transporting armies and blockading ports.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to view the admiral's details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: A navy from another nation. They are currently docked and may be replenishing their fleets or effecting repairs.
A port belonging to another nation. Ports can be military or trading ports and are used for trading, recruiting, repairing and replenishing navies.
A port belonging to another nation. Ports can be military or trading ports and are used for trading, recruiting, repairing and replenishing navies.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to view details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: An agent from another nation. He can be used to assassinate, sabotage, spy and steal.
A region capital belonging to another nation.
A resource belonging to another nation. Resources are used for farming and trade with other nations.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: This is a trade route. These are used for the import and export of trade

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: A town belonging to another nation. Towns can be developed along educational, entertainment or industrial chains.
A university belonging to another nation. Universities provide research into technologies.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: One of your agents.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: One of your armies. Use them to attack armies, besiege cities and blockade ports.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: One of your armies. This army can lay an ambush.
One of your forts. These are used to provide temporary protection for your armies.
Once your region's population has grown large enough, this harbour will become a port and you will be able to build upon it.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the admiral's panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: One of your navies. Use them to fight sea battles, transport your armies and blockade ports.
One of your ports. Ports can be military or trading ports and are used for trading, recruiting, repairing and replenishing navies.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: One of your ports. Ports can be military or trading ports and are used for trading, recruiting, repairing and replenishing navies.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Left click to select, double left click to bring up the details panel
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Your region capital. Construct buildings, manage your region and recruit your armies here.
One of your resources. Each region has its own resources, and they are used for farming and trade with other nations.
One of your towns. Different buildings are available in commercial, intelIectual or industrial centres, and each can be developed along military or civilian lines.
One of your universities. Universities are used to research into technologies.
Once your region's population has grown large enough, this village will become a town and you will be able to build upon it.

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Moving your agent here will place him under the protection of your army.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to move your agent into this army
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Moving your agent here will place him under the protection of your army.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to embark when the ship is at the coast
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your agent into this navy to transport them across the sea. He will be under the protection of the navy while travelling with them.
Remove any threat this agent may pose to your nation by assassinating them. Assess the chances of getting captured or killed yourself from the assassination panel.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: If there is an army here your agent will get an opportunity to spy or carry out an assassination.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: This agent cannot act against fleets
Right click to infiltrate target fleet
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Infiltrate this navy to relay intelligence about it back to your nation or attempt an assassination on its admiral or captain.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Sneak into this port to spy, perform sabotage or carry out an assassination.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Slip into this port to spy or perform sabotage. Any damage your agent does will prevent the owning nation from using it until repaired.
This agent is a potential threat to your nation. Spies are skilled in the art of sabotage, spying, and assassination - and as such should be taken care of as soon as possible.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your agent into this city to spy, perform sabotage or carry out an assassination.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your agent here to perform sabotage. Anything damaged will be unusable until repaired.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your agent here to perform sabotage. Anything damaged will be unusable until repaired.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to operate against target
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Move your agent into this university to spy, perform sabotage or carry out an assassination.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to move your agent into this army
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Moving your agent here will place him under the protection of your army and enable him to root out any enemy agents who have infiltrated the ranks.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to move your agent into this army
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Moving your agent here will place him under the protection of your army and enable him to root out any enemy agents who have infiltrated the ranks.
Place your agent here to root out any enemy agents.

campaign_map_tooltips.tooltip_line: Right click to embark when the ship is at the coast
campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: Place your agent onto a ship to transport him across the sea so he can carry out his nefarious schemes abroad!
Place your agent here to root out any enemy agents.
Place your agent here to root out any enemy agents.
Place your agent here to root out any enemy agents.

campaign_map_tooltips.advice_line: When travelling with an army, a scholar will be protected from assassination.
